channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: China is accelerating its nuclear weapons buildup because of growing fears of a conflict with the U.S., people with knowledge of the situation say https://t.co/Py9H62XnKj
Descendants of Ukrainians who arrived to Brazil decades ago are now welcoming war refugees from their old country 7,000 miles away—and hope they stay https://t.co/AQ5tr6ic4K
The U.S. is watching with dismay as several allied African military leaders—including officers with extensive American schooling—overthrow civilian governments and seize power https://t.co/Fbr5WpI5a6

Russian President Vladimir Putin’s private life and wealth are shrouded in secrecy. WSJ’s @AMSimmons1 explains what we know—and what we don’t. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/lIJqMgIZTb https://t.co/PwuEMM9oee
Europe is banning imports of two of Russia’s best-known specialties: caviar and vodka https://t.co/05h7cJyqHC
Dubai has become a busy parking spot for Russian private jets. But it is hard to leave and the meter charges $1,000 a day. https://t.co/JkK4Fk3tQc
Elon Musk joining Twitter’s board raises the question: Can one vote make a difference? Yes, outsiders can bring big changes to boardrooms and strategy–with mixed results https://t.co/bYDjXTEZSV
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/FHdCjRycf1 https://t.co/HiZpyz7zJf

“Everything Everywhere All at Once,” the gonzo martial-arts sci-fi comedy starring Michelle Yeoh, has big-name directors openly rooting for it to rev up the indie moviegoing experience https://t.co/bP6nzmuB5X

The U.S. will reposition a Patriot missile system to Slovakia following the Slovak government’s agreement to provide Ukraine with an S-300 air defense system, President Biden said on Friday https://t.co/8KiHZ7LF0k
China's leader Xi Jinping faces a spiraling Covid-19 outbreak and the return of lockdowns, twin troubles other world leaders hope their countries never see again. https://t.co/hXyK8au2N4
For Belarusian and Russian volunteers, the path to freedom at home runs through defeating the Russian army in Ukraine https://t.co/8ct11ClDav
From Soviet-era systems to drones and shoulder-launched missiles, Ukraine's air offensive has been a surprise trump card against Russia https://t.co/6Ui3zi7Kbg
Shanghai's Omicron outbreak has Beijing returning to an old playbook: More than 70 cities, accounting for about 40% of China's economic output, are in lockdown https://t.co/9Xvs9udyO7

Silicon Valley venture capitalist and bitcoin investor Peter Thiel lashed out at Warren Buffett, Jamie Dimon and Larry Fink, contending that they constitute a “financial gerontocracy” that conspires to hold down the price of the cryptocurrency https://t.co/kiRWhheeGp
Federal prosecutors are investigating the money trail behind two men accused of posing as federal agents to ingratiate themselves with Secret Service officers https://t.co/yib0qNbWwY
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/JqkHsnm2pq
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/sN6KbRTNje
Former Goldman Sachs banker Roger Ng was convicted of helping to loot billions of dollars from Malaysian sovereign wealth fund 1MDB https://t.co/Pep57WvmIl

From @WSJopinion: The United Nations vote to suspend Russia from the Human Rights Council is one more sign that the discovery of likely Russian war crimes in Ukraine is causing greater problems for the Kremlin https://t.co/80Yrlaw6cA

Officials said they were issuing orders to deny three Russian airlines— Aeroflot, Azur Air, and UTair—the ability to access U.S.-made parts or receive services from anyone anywhere in the world. https://t.co/TICQ8IMKdt
Breaking: Will Smith was banned from attending Oscars ceremonies for 10 years by the film academy after his awards-night slap of Chris Rock https://t.co/YFIjb9nWWz

The leaders of Britain and Germany condemned Russia’s attacks on civilians, and pledged to send more weapons to Ukraine and sharpen sanctions. “The killing of civilians is a war crime, and the Russian president bears responsibility for this.” https://t.co/mFJOy0bkEy
The Russian soldiers were polite at first when they seized Bucha. Then the killings started. "They turned into beasts." https://t.co/D31kBf9jQ3

Ukrainian officials said children were among the dozens of people killed by a Russian missile attack on a train station in the eastern part of the country. “This is an evil that has no limits,” Ukrainian President Zelensky said in an Instagram post. https://t.co/cxeMPGIC6b

Twitter said it will soon host an employee town hall with Elon Musk, its newest board member and largest shareholder, offering an opportunity for staffers to ask the billionaire questions directly https://t.co/2jKAdN3RaQ

Tesla CEO Elon Musk kicked off deliveries of the EV maker’s first made-in-Texas vehicles at a “Cyber Rodeo” event, unveiling its new Austin-area factory #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/Tz9IJYkS6e https://t.co/ynN1zliijn
Europe is banning imports of two of Russia’s best-known specialties: caviar and vodka https://t.co/tH8b8Ikp5c
Complaints rise that Germany is blocking stronger sanctions and refusing to send substantial military aid to Ukraine https://t.co/at5a1zS1yt
As Ukrainian officials continue to plead for military aid, the Biden administration is emphasizing the weapons it has delivered to Ukraine in the fight against Russia. https://t.co/JxhfTRIpwI
A missile attack on a busy railway station in eastern Ukraine killed dozens of people fleeing the Donbas region ahead of an expected Russian onslaught https://t.co/2TZ1GluHy1
The Russian soldiers were polite at first when they seized Bucha. Then the killings started. "They turned into beasts." https://t.co/iMKnDStyNq
Food shortages in Shanghai are leading to growing anxiety among residents of China’s wealthy coastal megacity, as strict Covid-19 lockdown measures continue https://t.co/w2St6KhsTW
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/RabfcnLeGz https://t.co/ITEE1hcMUN
From @WSJopinion: After failing to get a quick win in Ukraine, Russia’s Plan B is scorched earth, writes @DanHenninger https://t.co/AxVWvw9Toj
Pink Floyd is releasing a new song called “Hey Hey Rise Up” to support the people of Ukraine, marking the band’s first new recording in nearly three decades https://t.co/Y57amEUVPC
The Senate voted to strip Russia of most-favored-nation trade status and is set to back Biden's ban on oil imports. The House is expected to approve both bills. https://t.co/RbJLkmHcwJ

The Boston Marathon will exclude athletes from Russia and its military ally Belarus. Citizens of the two countries who aren’t currently residents of either can still race if they were accepted during open registration. https://t.co/TOY0jdZlyU

Ukrainian officials called for more weapons to fight Russia as both sides mobilize forces in the east for what are expected to be some of the fiercest battles of the war so far https://t.co/gcfsodCxg8
Breaking: Ketanji Brown Jackson was confirmed as the 116th Supreme Court justice. Her ascent diversifies the bench, while leaving in place its conservative tilt. https://t.co/s0Z0CnzUsX
From @WSJopinion: If the U.S. doesn’t improve its logistics systems, defending Taiwan against China will be difficult, writes @sethcropsey https://t.co/XoGS4Xr8RP
The U.S. took its first actions to enforce the bans on the export of technology and industrial goods to Russia in response to the country’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/UUxH84ZgWO

India’s Gautam Adani is the newest centibillionaire with a net worth of over $100 billion, joining Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos among the world’s top 10 wealthiest people #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/Wdaibj7rBo https://t.co/j6ERH9MrEE

To keep its supply chain humming, Walmart is raising starting salaries for truck drivers to between $95,000 and $110,000 a year and expanding a training program that enables its employees to enter the field https://t.co/47b8IpbgsB
For Belarusian and Russian volunteers, the path to freedom at home runs through defeating the Russian army in Ukraine https://t.co/X8YQ2ygic0
From Soviet-era systems to drones and shoulder-launched missiles, Ukraine's air offensive has been a surprise trump card against Russia https://t.co/SKoqoebL0C

Turkey is fast becoming a haven for Russian money, from oligarchs parking their superyachts on the country’s shores to young dissidents and tech workers flying from Moscow with cash in suitcases https://t.co/h1Eoiq7RsR
U.S. and European moves to sanction two adult daughters of Russian President Vladimir Putin cast a spotlight on a family shrouded for years in secrecy https://t.co/yrfFpD4CKX

From @WSJopinion: Elon Musk hasn’t disclosed his agenda for Twitter, but for now we’ll consider this a hopeful moment for political speech and debate at America’s increasingly censorious tech giants. https://t.co/BeU9s7CXWe
Kyiv’s residents are emerging from basements and subway stations following Russia’s withdrawal, but remain skeptical that they have seen the last of Russian forces https://t.co/bey2Fhr8sW
